meanings.definition: To make or become a case.
meanings.sent1: She was casefying her phone in a protective cover.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was casefying the delicate jewelry box.
meanings.sent3: The magician was casefying the rabbit in a tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar was casefying itself in a cocoon.
meanings.sent5: The artist was casefying the precious painting in a glass frame.

meanings.definition: To encase or enclose in a case.
meanings.sent1: He carefully casefied the fragile vase in bubble wrap.
meanings.sent2: The detective casefied the evidence in a transparent bag.
meanings.sent3: The chef casefied the secret recipe in a locked box.
meanings.sent4: The beekeeper casefied the queen bee in a special hive.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler casefied the diamond ring in a velvet pouch.

meanings.definition: The act of putting into a case or covering with a case.
meanings.sent1: The casefying of the documents took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: The casefying of the camera provided protection during travel.
meanings.sent3: The casefying of the cupcakes in individual boxes made them look fancy.
meanings.sent4: The casefying of the laptop in a sleek sleeve was convenient for the student.
meanings.sent5: The casefying of the phone in a colorful cover reflected her personality.
